column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The Chemical Wedding by Christian Rosencreutz
#Text=A ROMANCE IN EIGHT DAYS by JOHANN VALENTIN ANDREAE in a new version by JOHN CROWLEY illustrated by THEO FADEL
#Text=SMALL BEER PRESS EASTHAMPTON , MASS .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=I
#Text=The Chemical Wedding by Christian Rosencreutz is the way I ’ve decided to present the title of this book .
#Text=Most versions in English are called The Chemical Wedding of Christian Rosencreutz , which suggests ( and most people who ’ve heard of it suppose ) that the wedding is Christian ’s .
#Text=It ’s not ; Christian Rosencreutz is the purported author of a book called The Chemical Wedding .
#Text=The actual author is Johann Valentin Andreae , whose name did n’t appear on the book originally , thus ensuring the confusion .
#Text=I ’ll call it herein ( as everyone mostly does ) simply The Chemical Wedding .

#Text=Though its original readers would have had a certain amount of context for the truly bizarre and surprising events it tells of , it ’s possible that The Chemical Wedding is now more enjoyable without knowing that context , and experiencing the book unmediated .
#Text=You might therefore wish to start right in on the first page of text that follows and only then return to this introduction .
#Text=Consider a similar case : a little book published in 1934 by the Surrealist artist Max Ernst called Une Semaine de Bonté .
#Text=It was made entirely of collaged illustrations cut out of old books
#Text=The First Day
#Text=It was just before Easter Sunday , 1 and I was sitting at my table .
#Text=I ’d said my prayers , talking a long time as usual with my Maker and thinking about some of the great mysteries the Father of Lights had revealed to me .
#Text=Now I was ready to make and to bake – only in my heart , actually – a small , perfect unleavened wafer to eat with my beloved Paschal Lamb .

#Text=All of a sudden a terrible wind blew up , so strong that I thought the hill my little house was built on would be blown apart – but I ’d seen the Devil do things as bad as this before ( the Devil had often tried to harm me ) , so I took heart and went on meditating .
#Text=Till I felt somebody touch me on the back .
#Text=This frightened me so that I did n’t dare turn .
#Text=I tried to stay as brave and calm as a human being could under the circumstances .
#Text=I felt my coat tugged at , and tugged again , and at last I looked around .
#Text=A woman stood there , so bright and beautiful , in a sky - colored robe – a heavens covered with
#Text=1 Christian ’s story begins just before Easter , like Dante ’s Divine Comedy .
#Text=It can be seen as an allegory of Christ ’s death and resurrection , though this idea produces some puzzles .
#Text=The birds sang so beautifully , the young deer skipped so happily , that it gladdened my old heart , and I could n't help singing too ...
#Text=THE FOURTH DAY

#Text=I was awake and lying in bed next morning , looking idly at the wonderful images and inscriptions all around my room , when suddenly I heard the sound of trumpets , as if a procession were already underway .
#Text=My page jumped out of bed as if crazed , looking more dead than alive , and you can imagine how I felt when he cried , “ They 're already being presented to the king ! "
